title: TVM library
description: TVM library is a very small javascript library with finance-related functions.

title: UCM Kiosk System
description:
The UCM Kiosk System was a group project done in CIS 4690 class in Fall 2014. This is the final class we go through as CIS majors, and we implemented this application as a replacement for the board of names in the Dockery Building, which is easily out-dated.

It allows administrators to edit departments and users, as well as giving users access to certain departments. These users can login through the back end and edit courses and professors for the departments they have access to.

All of this information is organized in a nice front end for the student, which sees it in a large 50" touch screen TV in the Dockery Building.

title: Gradetracker Application
description: Built originally for my girlfriend, this application is able to track students

images.description: Browse school years for user account
Browse standards and students for school year
Add a student to the roster

title: City of Warrensburg Website
description: I redesigned the City of Warrensburg's website with residents, visitors and local businesses in mind alongside the System Administrator. Each department is now able to manage their own content and the entire site is much more organized along with being mobile/tablet friendly and very easy to maintain.

title: DECA Tickets Application
description: I developed this application for a student organization that sells tickets as a part of its primary fundraiser. Contributors were able to login and maintain ticket records in order to keep information current, to better serve potential customers.

title: Hoorfar Law Website
description: I developed this website from scratch with help from Hoorfar Law's previous website. Much of the content stayed the same in the redesign, while adding some neat effects to some of the pages, a cleaner overall design and with responsive capability (mobile/tablet friendly).

title: UCM University Store Website
description: I built the front end of this website as a part of a 2013 redesign project, and have maintained this website since my freshman year of college. I've implemented some newer things into the site like jquery and using some ui components from bootstrap front end framework.

title: Backyard by Design KC
description: I joined Cara and Boxspring Design for this project, and implemented their design ideas into this responsive web package using custom themeing in wordpress/php.

title: Pets
description: This site was built as an experiment at first for my girlfriend, and all of the pets that are in our life. It's essentially a photoblog with tools built in the back end to maintain the pet information, and using dynamic pages to grab content from the database.

title: Tasks
description: Tasks was an experiment at first, that turned into a project that I was actually using to manage daily tasks. Users can create lists, and compile tasks into these lists, and be able to edit their information and status. This webapp is also reponsive and built with bootstrap.

title: Book Xchange
description: We built this web application as a part of a final project in the web development course at school. It's built with php and is able to handle many different functions in creating and trading textbooks. It's also built to maintain many different user accounts that can interact with each other in the process of purchasing a book from each other.

title: Baseball Stat Tracker
description: We built this web application as a part of a final project in the java development course at school. It's basically a real-time baseball game statistic logger, that enables a user to simply click buttons to log events and keep track of the current status of a game. Games are updated in the database each time a button is clicked and therefore able to switch back and forth between games if needed.
